content.description:
Head up the bulging prow to a horizontal crack and follow a left leaning crack system [var] up the angled ledge above. Variation: instead of exiting left, you can trend right to the dihedral and exit right (5.10a/b) Small prow to the left of La Lou. Single rack, small nuts (RPs).
Single glue-in anchor + slung boulder, possible to rap from La Lou's double bolts which are lower right (climber's).

Climb up the offwidth crack to a stance under the small roof. Take the crack to the left [V1]. At a horizontal diagonal back right to a belay. Pitch 2: [V2] Continue climbing to the right following ramps and cracks to a ledge. Then break back left to a belay. V1: 5.9 From under the small roof after the OW, climb out right into a right facing corner. Continue along the open book until a steep finger crack presents itself. Climb it and a couple ledges to the final bolted belay. V2: 5.10b From the P1 belay climb left along a ramp to a steep crack. Once atop the crack head right to the final belay. 60' right of Sceptre Standard rack plus a large cam may be helpful but not necessary.

For Var 1:
Double up on small cams! BD #.1 to #.4

Pitch 1 Same as Traversée except you keep going straight (climbers right) to a ledge with trees. Pitch 2 Go up to dihedrals to a large ledge and go up a small bump. Pitch 3 Go left 10m and head up the wall to the trees and bolts. Pitch 4 From the (bolted) belay at the top of the 3rd pitch, head upwards over slabby 5.3ish terrain to a large block at the base of a small vertical section leading to a ledge. On top of this ledge is a bolted anchor (last move is exciting and very Rish). Please find someone that has done this climb before to show you the way... The route's name comes from: "I wish I were a little worm With bristles on my tummy, I'd climb into a honey pot And get my tummy gummy, Then I'd climb all over you And get your tummy gummy too!" look for a ledge a couple meters off the ground with bushes on it. Standard rack.
Most belays are bolted.

Area just right of Sceptre, a mix of wandering routes.

Zone située juste à droite du Sceptre, un mélange de voies errantes.

Areas from Left to Right:
Amphitheatre
Zébrée
Impériale
Crown (Above Impériale)
Profil Grec (Above Sceptre)
Traversée
Vallot
Staircase
